item.title: Best Triple-A Survival Games
item.description:
Survival games have evolved from niche experiments into large-scale productions supported by some of the biggest studios in the gaming industry. With each passing year, developers introduce expansive worlds, intricate systems, and new interpretations of what it means to endure against overwhelming odds in worlds that are far from friendly.

While a large portion of the Survival genre's success has come from smaller budget developers, there are still a few bigger projects that have managed to carve out a name for themselves in one of gaming's most contested spaces, demonstrating that the AAA label can still bring success despite the stigma.

Atomfall

Paranoia In A Brutal Cold War Landscape

Atomfall
6 /10
15
7.1 /10
Released
March 27, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
Teen // Blood, Language, Violence
Developer(s)
Rebellion Developments
Powered by

Set in an alternate history Britain, Atomfall imagines a world scarred by a nuclear disaster during the height of the Cold War. Developed with the backing of a major studio, the game emphasizes the uncertainty of life amid radiation zones, paramilitary forces, and dwindling resources. The narrative leans on mistrust and mystery, immersing players in a survival setting where the human threat is as pressing as environmental hazards.

Beyond its atmospheric presentation, Atomfall integrates mechanics such as scavenging, health management, and quick decision-making under pressure. The attention to realism reinforces its AAA scope, ensuring that survival feels visceral and demanding at all times. The combination of the setting and the gameplay itself allows the game to stand apart as a cerebral take on survival in a fractured society.

Dune: Awakening

A Desert World Where No Place Is Safe

Dune: Awakening
22
9.1 /10
Released
June 10, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Funcom
Powered by

Few settings lend themselves to survival as naturally as Arrakis, the hostile desert world of Dune . In Dune: Awakening , survival is not optional, but it is the central struggle, as players contend with the ever-present threat of sandworms, scorching temperatures, and rival factions, all while navigating a landscape where water is more valuable than gold.

The challenge of survival is amplified by social dynamics, with the multiplayer environments meaning that rival players can be as dangerous as the desert itself. Combined with resource scarcity and factional politics, Dune: Awakening elevates survival into a strategic challenge, where adapting to ecological and social pressures determines the player's success in the world.

Grounded

Shrinking Down To Minuscule Size

Grounded
7.8 /10
Released
September 27, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood, Mild Language, Violence
Developer(s)
Obsidian Entertainment
Powered by

Developed by Obsidian Entertainment, Grounded brings survival all the way down to the scale of a backyard, transforming everyday insects and plants into threats of towering proportions. Despite its playful premise, the survival systems are rigorous, with hunger, thirst, crafting, and environmental hazards all needing to be carefully managed.

The game’s cooperative mechanics also highlight survival as a shared responsibility. Players must collaborate to gather resources, construct shelters, and fend off threats, reinforcing the communal aspects of the genre. Its inventive perspective shows how a triple-A studio can innovate within a genre, in this case, by making the ordinary feel extraordinary.

S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2: Heart of Chornobyl

It's Called The "Exclusion Zone" For A Reason

S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2: Heart of Chornobyl
28
8.5 /10
Released
November 20, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Intense Violence, Blood, Use Of Drugs And Alcohol, Language, Crude Humor
Developer(s)
GSC Game World
Powered by

S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2: Heart of Chornobyl continues the legacy of its cult classic predecessors by bringing the horrors of the Exclusion Zone to the gaming world. Developed with cutting-edge technology, it immerses players in a beautiful yet haunting world defined by radiation, anomalies, and hostile factions.

Atmosphere is at the core of the experience. Bleak landscapes, unsettling sound design, and unpredictable encounters ensure that progress feels earned, not granted. By merging open-world exploration with uncompromising survival mechanics, S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2 positions itself as a definitive expression of the Survival genre on a blockbuster scale.

Dying Light

Zombie Slaying Meets Parkour Momentum

Dying Light
7 /10
12
9.1 /10
Released
January 27, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Developer(s)
Techland
Powered by

Dying Light redefines urban survival by blending open-world parkour with relentless zombie threats. Its AAA budget is evident in the fluidity of movement, dynamic day-night cycle, and visceral combat that delivers an unmatched level of satisfaction, no matter what kind of weapon the player is using.

During the day, scavenging for supplies and crafting weapons is central to survival, but once night falls, the infected become significantly more dangerous, turning every journey into a desperate gamble. By giving players agency through agility, the game sets a new precedent for how AAA survival titles can innovate on traversal as much as on combat.

Far Cry Primal

Something Completely Different From A Beloved Franchise

Far Cry Primal
8 /10
7.7 /10
Released
February 23, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Sexual Content
Developer(s)
Ubisoft Montreal
Powered by

Far Cry Primal transports players back to a prehistoric world, where survival hinges on primitive tools, hunting, and tribal warfare. Ubisoft’s commitment to authenticity shines in the crafting system, which demands reliance on materials such as stone, bone, and animal hides. With no firearms or modern conveniences on hand, survival is raw and immediate, heightening the player’s dependence on ingenuity and environmental awareness.

Far Cry Primal further emphasizes survival through its predator-prey dynamic. Dangerous animals roam the wilderness, requiring skillful tracking and taming, and by positioning players as both hunter and hunted, the game feels as much about endurance as it does intelligence.

item.title: Xbox Insider Pushes Back on Halo AI Rumors
item.description:
Despite ongoing rumors, the next Halo game will not utilize generative AI in its development, according to a known Xbox and gaming industry insider on social media. The insider clarified that Xbox Game Studios currently has no mandate to use generative AI in Halo or other games. However, the controversial technology may still be used for emails and other tasks.

Although Halo is one of Microsoft's cornerstone gaming franchises, the hit FPS series has not seen any new releases since the launch of 2021's Halo Infinite and the canceled Halo TV series. However, rumors about a remake of Halo: Combat Evolved have circulated on social media, claiming that the first title in the franchise could make a return in some capacity with modern features and a sprint function. As of this writing, Microsoft has stated that fans interested in the future of the Halo franchise should tune into the 2025 Halo World Championship on Friday, October 24, at the Seattle Convention Center.

Insider States Halo Is Not Using Generative AI

While previous reports stated that PlayStation and Xbox could utilize generative AI in game development, an insider said that this will not be the case for the latter company. According to Xbox insider Jez Corden on Twitter, the next Halo game project is not using generative AI in its ongoing development or in any art assets. Corden stated that Xbox Game Studios has not mandated any of its subsidiaries to utilize generative AI in game development. However, Corden said that Xbox's usage of generative AI is likely restricted to sending emails and other tasks unrelated to game development. Corden's post about Xbox Game Studios comes as a contrast to Microsoft's current push toward incorporating its own AI-based technologies. Apps like Copilot are included in Windows 11's user interface via operating system updates.

In response to Corden's tweet, another user replied that Microsoft may utilize procedural generation as an AI-based component in the Halo series rather than generative AI in its development. Procedural generation is not a new concept to the gaming industry, as titles like Minesweeper and Minecraft use it to create levels of varying difficulty that players can enjoy. Procedural generation is also utilized in MMORPGs like World of Warcraft to determine the loot that players receive after defeating enemies in a dungeon or raid instance.

Though major companies like Nintendo have shown no interest in using generative AI in games, Microsoft's usage of it outside of game development remains a sticking point with users. Only time will tell what Microsoft's actual plans are for the next Halo game.

20
8.1 /10
9 /10

Halo Infinite

item.title: It’s Obvious Now: This Animal Crossing-Like is Poised to Go Head-to-Head With Nintendo
item.description:
For many gamers, Animal Crossing: New Horizons was the one thing that made the COVID-19 lockdown bearable. It truly released at the perfect time, as players were able to distract themselves from the horrors of the outside world by paying off their debt to an adorable raccoon and designing the island getaway of their dreams. Still, following the release of the Happy Home Paradise DLC, Animal Crossing: New Horizons has stopped receiving new content, leaving cozy gamers to ponder what’s next for their favorite franchise.

With the future of the Animal Crossing IP currently shrouded in mystery, many will likely seek out Animal Crossing -like experiences to fill the void. This has been a consistent practice for fans of games like Stardew Valley for years now, so it’s only natural that the same approach be applied to Animal Crossing . While some controversial Animal Crossing rip-offs have shown up in the past, players looking for a high-quality experience that checks some of the same boxes while still forging its own path have one breathtaking project to look forward to: Animula Nook . In fact, given where the game seems to be in its development process, as well as the LilliLandia title’s platform selection, Animula Nook might just steal the attention of Animal Crossing fans.

Animula Nook’s TBA Switch 2 Launch Coincides With Animal Crossing’s Release Pattern

Via Animula Nook ’s trailer and official website, players get confirmation of a game-changing detail. In addition to PlayStation, Xbox, Steam, and Epic Games Store releases, the cozy title will be dropping for Nintendo Switch 2. This could end up making it a direct competitor to the Animal Crossing franchise on that series' home turf, as while it wouldn’t matter as much if Animula Nook were to be releasing in 2025 or 2026, it currently lacks a release window. Though this is purely speculation, a 2027 or 2028 launch seems quite probable, as some kind of window would have likely been shared if it was further along into development. Intriguingly, this proposed window would be right about when a new Animal Crossing project can be expected.

Even if Animula Nook surprises with a 2026 release date, if the game is as good as it looks and receives consistent updates, it beating Nintendo to the punch could place more pressure on the next Animal Crossing .

Going by the eight-year gap between Animal Crossing: New Leaf and New Horizons , it can be assumed that there will be a similar wait for the new title, especially with extra pressure to perform thanks to all the new fans the most recent game acquired. It’s been over 5 years since New Horizons debuted, meaning that a new Animal Crossing dropping in late 2027 or early 2028 is a safe bet. If this is indeed the case, there’s a very real chance that Animal Crossing ends up going head-to-head with Animula Nook , with both being compared even more than they normally would be had they released further apart.

Why Animula Nook is Perfect For Animal Crossing Fans

There are plenty of reasons for Animal Crossing fans to give Animula Nook a chance, as there are some clear similarities between the two cozy games, such as:

  • Animal NPCs called Minies. Animula Nook features bunny characters like Kayee, Septem, and Pudding as well as a cat named Meowrio.
  • A focus on decoration, one of the defining elements of the Animal Crossing franchise.
  • Deep character customization so players can make their protagonist look just like them.

However, the game also has its own unique traits, such as the concept of exploring a real-world setting as a tiny character like in the critically acclaimed It Takes Two . Players will transform clocks into rocking chair decorations, live inside milk cartons, and so on. Exploration also appears to be a big focus, as gamers will fly across the world on a feline ball called a Wupa and collect balls of sunshine for an unknown purpose. With a spectacular art style and these distinct mechanics, the game stands out a bit from Animal Crossing without straying too far from what makes that game special.

If Animula Nook lives up to its full potential and the actual game blows fans away as much as its reveal trailer did, Nintendo might just regret letting it release on the Switch 2, as it could end up making the next Animal Crossing feel a bit less special. Perhaps the two games will give each other distance, and maybe players will end up not having to choose one or the other, but Animal Crossing ’s recent release gaps and the lack of a release date for Animula Nook leave open the door for an intense competition.

34
8.7 /10
9 /10

Animal Crossing: New Horizons

item.title: Roblox Plants vs Brainrots: Best Plants Tier List
item.description:
Plants vs Brainrots is a Roblox take on the classic Plants vs. Zombies . The core idea is the same: plant seeds in your base to fight off incoming enemies. The twist is that any Brainrot your plants defeat can become yours, either generating extra cash per second or being sold instantly for in-game money. Owning powerful plants is essential if you want to dominate, since Brainrots and bosses come with different HP levels, and weaker plants simply won’t cut it . Here’s a tier list to help you understand which plants perform best in Roblox Plants vs Brainrots .

Updated by Somiya Adrees on October 19, 2025: Plants vs Brainrots has a variety of plants to pick for defeating foes, each with different cooldown and DPS that decide how fast and effective their attacks are. As the roster has grown, we’ve updated this guide to include all the best units available for players up to the 1.6.0 update.

Roblox Plants vs Brainrots: Best Plants Tier List

Right now, there are 16 plants in Plants vs. Brainrots , and the most OP ones are those that can shred enemy's Hp the fastest.

This tier list ranks them from S to C based on base damage, though that can shift if a plant grows into a heavier-weight version. In that case, anything with 1k to 5k DPS (damage per second) counts as A-tier, and anything tougher gets bumped up to S-tier.

All Plants

Tier Ranking

Reasoning

Commando Apple

S Tier

A limited-time seed that carries a weapon and has the highest DPS of 11.6k.

King Limone

S Tier

Although it dropped after Mango, its DPS is about on par with it at 9k .

Mango

S Tier

This seed shows up more often than Shroombino in the shop and is currently stronger with its 9k DPS.

Shroombino

S Tier

A secret-rarity plant that can deal 7k damage per second to Brainrots.

Tomatrio

A Tier

Another awesome crop, with the ability to inflict 5k DPS.

Mr Carrot

A Tier

Though a secret unit, it ranks in A-tier for delivering a decent 3.5k DPS .

Carnivorous Plant

A Tier

A flesh-eating plant with a mouth that inflict 2.5k DPS on incoming enemies and bosses.

Grape

A Tier

Grape is a mythical plant that’s affordable and attacks with 1.7k DPS .

Cocotank

A Tier

A plant resembling a military-style tank that dishes out 1.2k continuous damage.

Watermelon

B Tier

With a base DPS of 750 , this plant falls in B-tier.

Eggplant

B Tier

A legendary-rarity seed that grows into a plant with 500 base DPS .

Dragon Fruit

B Tier

Another legendary plant that can hit Brainrots and enemies for 250 DPS .

Sunflower

C Tir

DMG output isn’t great, but a good pick for beginners (115 DPS) .

Pumpkin

C Tier

Epic-rarity plant that does minimal damage of 55 per second.

Strawberry

C Tier

Similar to Pumpkin but with even lower output, only 25 DPS .

Cactus

C Tier

Not really worth planting unless you have nothing better (10 DPS) .

Best Plants in Plants vs Brainrots

  • The best plants in Plants vs Brainrots are definitely Commando Apple and King Limone . The first is a limited premium seed, while the second is a secret one obtained with in-game cash. Both are strong enough to guard your base and wipe out most Brainrots.
  • In case you don’t have King Limone, Mango can give pretty similar results, so it’s worth grabbing from the shop. Shroombino , on the other hand, is harder to get but is still one of the top-tier plants.
  • If you’ve got more than 50M, Mr. Carrot and Carnivorous Plant are great selections, with even greater power if you manage to get bigger variants.
  • Cocotank and Grape are lifesavers against Legendary and Mythical Brainrots, though they won’t always hold up against Godly, Secret, or Limited-rarity enemies.

If you’re a pay-to-win player, you can grab the Damage Potion from the Robux shop for 199 Robux. It boosts your plants’ damage by up to 50%.

447
8.8 /10

Roblox

item.title: Township Codes (October 2025)
item.description:
Jump Links

  • All Township Codes
  • How to Redeem Township Codes
  • How to Get More Township Codes

Playing Township you have to build and manage your own town almost from scratch. And the main activity for earning money is, of course, farming and producing various goods for residents. And if you want to get rich as quickly as possible, you should use Township codes.

Codes can contain various rewards, including quite large amounts of Cash. Also, some of them grant players unique decorations. But in order not to miss out on free goodies, you need to have time to redeem codes while they are still active.

Updated October 19, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: There are currently no active codes available for Township . You can still enjoy plenty of in-game rewards through regular events, seasonal challenges, and daily bonuses. Keep checking back here, as new offers and freebies may be added in future updates.

All Township Codes

Working Township Codes

There are no active codes in Township . We will update this article as soon as more codes become available.

Expired Township Codes

  • FREEBONUS2023
  • TOWNSHIPAPRILFOOLS
  • TOWNSHIPBYPLAYRIX
  • SPRING2023
  • TOWNSHIPLOVE
  • TOWNSHIPFUN
  • TOWNSHIPGIFT
  • FREEGIFT2023

Township has everything you can expect from a farming simulator and even more. In addition to growing crops and breeding animals, you can play various mini-games to earn more money or get extra resources. But it is worth noting that almost all actions in the game take a lot of time, which can be reduced by spending Cash. As it is a premium currency, it is quite difficult to earn it. The exception is Township codes.

Just a few of these codes will be enough for players to get several hundred Cash and other useful rewards in a few seconds. The disadvantage of this method is the codes' short validity. So after some time after the release, each code expires and the rewards become no longer available. Therefore, we recommend that you hurry to use them.

How to Redeem Township Codes

Now that you know what goodies each of the active Township codes contains, you should learn how to get them. Fortunately, this can be done in just a couple of taps, even if you have just started building your city in this free mobile game. For convenience, you should follow these steps:

  • First, launch Township .
  • Then, open the settings by clicking on the button in the upper right corner and then on the gear icon.
  • After that, select the Enter Promo Code option.
  • Next, you must enter the code and tap on the Confirm button to claim free rewards.

How to Get More Township Codes

Developers add new codes to Township quite often. As with most other mobile games, fresh codes can be found on the official developers' social media pages:

  • Official Township Mobile on Facebook
  • Official Township Mobile on Instagram

Township is available on mobile devices.
